title: Job 36:1
text: ELIHU also proceeded, and said,

title: Job 36:2
text: Suffer me a little, and I will shew thee that I have yet to speak on God's behalf.

title: Job 36:3
text: I will fetch my knowledge from afar, and will ascribe righteousness to my Maker.

title: Job 36:4
text: For truly my words shall not be false: he that is perfect in knowledge is with thee.

title: Job 36:5
text: Behold, God is mighty, and despiseth not any: he is mighty in strength and wisdom.

title: Job 36:6
text: He preserveth not the life of the wicked: but giveth right to the poor.

title: Job 36:7
text: He withdraweth not his eyes from the righteous: but with kings are they on the throne; yea, he doth establish them for ever, and they are exalted.

title: Job 36:8
text: And if they be bound in fetters, and be holden in cords of affliction;

title: Job 36:9
text: Then he sheweth them their work, and their transgressions that they have exceeded.

title: Job 36:10
text: He openeth also their ear to discipline, and commandeth that they return from iniquity.

title: Job 36:11
text: If they obey and serve him, they shall spend their days in prosperity, and their years in pleasures.

title: Job 36:12
text: But if they obey not, they shall perish by the sword, and they shall die without knowledge.

title: Job 36:13
text: But the hypocrites in heart heap up wrath: they cry not when he bindeth them.

title: Job 36:14
text: They die in youth, and their life is among the unclean.

title: Job 36:15
text: He delivereth the poor in his affliction, and openeth their ears in oppression.

title: Job 36:16
text: Even so would he have removed thee out of the strait into a broad place, where there is no straitness; and that which should be set on thy table should be full of fatness.

title: Job 36:17
text: But thou hast fulfilled the judgment of the wicked: judgment and justice take hold on thee.

title: Job 36:18
text: Because there is wrath, beware lest he take thee away with his stroke: then a great ransom cannot deliver thee.

title: Job 36:19
text: Will he esteem thy riches?  no, not gold, nor all the forces of strength.

title: Job 36:20
text: Desire not the night, when people are cut off in their place.

title: Job 36:21
text: Take heed, regard not iniquity: for this hast thou chosen rather than affliction.

title: Job 36:22
text: Behold, God exalteth by his power: who teacheth like him?

title: Job 36:23
text: Who hath enjoined him his way?  or who can say, Thou hast wrought iniquity?

title: Job 36:24
text: Remember that thou magnify his work, which men behold.

title: Job 36:25
text: Every man may see it; man may behold it afar off.

title: Job 36:26
text: Behold, God is great, and we know him not, neither can the number of his years be searched out.

title: Job 36:27
text: For he maketh small the drops of water: they pour down rain according to the vapour thereof:

title: Job 36:28
text: Which the clouds do drop and distil upon man abundantly.

title: Job 36:29
text: Also can any understand the spreadings of the clouds, or the noise of his tabernacle?

title: Job 36:30
text: Behold, he spreadeth his light upon it, and covereth the bottom of the sea.

title: Job 36:31
text: For by them judgeth he the people; he giveth meat in abundance.

title: Job 36:32
text: With clouds he covereth the light; and commandeth it not to shine by the cloud that cometh betwixt.

title: Job 36:33
text: The noise thereof sheweth concerning it, the cattle also concerning the vapour.
